speaker: GIBSON
line: Checkmate.

speaker: CSM
line: Go on! Take your shot, Alex!

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Right there! I was … sent to bring you back.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wow, you know you’re going places in the Bureau when the Assistant Director tidies up your office for you. What’s up?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I was just, uh … looking.

speaker: MULDER
line: For anything special?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I came down to ask you something. I, uh, I guess I was nosing around – wondering about you -- your, uh, long-term plans.

speaker: MULDER
line: My long term plans? You got them right there in your hands.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What do you hope to find? I mean, in the end.

speaker: MULDER
line: Whatever I hope to find is in here. And maybe I’ll know it when I find it. Is that what you came to ask me?

speaker: SKINNER
line: No. There’s a case – nothing I’d send you normally – a murder … an assassination of a Russian chess player. The shooter is former National Security Agency … one of ours. It’s got a lot of people upset. This kid, Jeffery Spender – Special Agent Spender – he’s been given the case. He’s running it.

speaker: MULDER
line: You give it to him?

speaker: SKINNER
line: No. It came as an order from somewhere outside the Bureau. His team’s assembled upstairs right now. He was very specific that you be excluded.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Using a weapon registered to a US intelligence agency, the shooter fired one kill shot at Anatole Klebanow before being captured without incident a short distance from the scene. .

speaker: SPENDER
line: No motive has been established nor has the shooter offered up a statement or accomplice.

speaker: MULDER
line: Please continue.

speaker: SPENDER
line: The trajectory of the kill shot suggests the shooter acted alone, but we cannot yet rule out an accomplice or conspiracy. A single bullet was fired from a catwalk at a steep angle striking the target just right of the solar plexus.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m … sorry, can you rewind the tape? Please. I’ll tell you where. Just take it back?

speaker: SPENDER
line: Let me get through this. If you have any questions, we can talk later.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t have any questions. No. I just think you’re wrong.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder … what are you doing?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t think the Russian was the target. I think it was his opponent.

speaker: SPENDER
line: His opponent, Agent Mulder, was a twelve year old boy.

speaker: MULDER
line: And a good chess player. Here, let me show you his best move, if you’ll just take it back.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, stop it there. Look what the kid does right here, right before the kill shot. Play. Do you see what he does? He just pushes back. You see that?

speaker: SPENDER
line: He just completed a checkmate. He’s pushing back because the game’s over.

speaker: MULDER
line: You described a steep trajectory for the kill shot. If the kid doesn’t push back at that precise moment he catches the bullet in the back of the neck, not the Russian.

speaker: SPENDER
line: May we move on here?

speaker: DIANA
line: I think Agent Mulder is right. Looks like the boy sensed the shooter precognitively . If you rewind the tape you’ll see it.

speaker: SPENDER
line: There’s no way. It’s impossible.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Just rewind the tape so we can all see for ourselves.

speaker: CSM
line: You look surprised. Is it that I’m here or that I’m alive?

speaker: FIRST ELDER
line: When we heard you’d been shot, we’d assumed the worst.

speaker: SECOND ELDER
line: There were reports you lost too much blood to have survived.

speaker: CSM
line: Obviously, you underestimated me. More obviously you overestimated the man you sent to do the job.

speaker: CSM
line: Well, let’s say all is forgiven. Now, you have a job for me.

speaker: WMM
line: There’s been an incident … an unfortunate mistake.

speaker: CSM
line: Yes, I’ve seen. I’ve heard. I’ve read.

speaker: THIRD ELDER
line: The boy is a problem to us.

speaker: CSM
line: What would you like me to do … Shoot him dead … splatter his brains?

speaker: WMM
line: Dear God …

speaker: CSM
line: What’s the matter? Does this sort of business offend you?

speaker: FIRST ELDER
line: It’s in your interest … as in ours.

speaker: CSM
line: You think you know my interests?

speaker: FIRST ELDER
line: Can we count on you?

speaker: CSM
line: Yes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How long have you been with the Bureau, Agent Fowley?

speaker: DIANA
line: Since ’91. I took an assignment in Europe after the wall came down when the director stepped up foreign terrorism concerns.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And they brought you on this because of a terrorism angle?

speaker: DIANA
line: No. I, uh, I requested a reassignment. There were things at home I decided I wanted to get back to.

speaker: SCULLY
line: 1991. That’s about when you started work on the X-Files.

speaker: MULDER
line: More or less, yeah.

speaker: HOMER SIMPSON
line: Uh... I'd better just put it down.

speaker: LISA SIMPSON
line: No offense, Mom, but that was pretty cool.

speaker: MARGE SIMPSON
line: Homer, I think you'd agree...

speaker: MULDER
line: Hi. My name is Fox. This is Dana and Diana. How are you doing?

speaker: GIBSON
line: I don’t mind it here. They get all the good TV shows. Where I live, in the Philippines all we get is Baywatch.

speaker: MULDER
line: What’s wrong with Baywatch?

speaker: GIBSON
line: You’ve got a dirty mind.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Your parents are going to pick you up on Friday, Gibson, to take you back home.

speaker: GIBSON
line: I don’t want to play any chess.

speaker: MULDER
line: How do you know I want to?

speaker: GIBSON
line: ‘Cause you got that cheapo chess computer in your hand.

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s not so cheap. Don’t you want to see how fast you can beat it?

speaker: GIBSON
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe because you can’t.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m right, aren’t I? You know what I’m talking about. You knew the moment I came in. That’s how you win, isn’t it … how you know what your opponent’s going to do? You get inside his head. You read his thoughts. That’s how you knew that man was going to shoot you … isn’t it?

speaker: GIBSON
line: I know what’s on your mind. I know you’re thinking about one of the girls you brought.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh?

speaker: GIBSON
line: One of them’s thinking about you.

speaker: DIANA
line: Which one?

speaker: GIBSON
line: He doesn’t want me to say.

speaker: MULDER
line: This kid’s going to need round-the-clock protection.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder … What was that all about?

speaker: MULDER
line: The kid’s no chess master. Under controlled conditions, I could probably beat him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, he’s recognized internationally as a prodigy. He’s beaten Grand Masters.

speaker: MULDER
line: With the most unfair advantage. What he’s doing amounts to a kind of parlor magic trick.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, he was goofing on you. He was playing along. You’re positing that this kid can read minds.

speaker: MULDER
line: We’ve seen a number of these cases before, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We have seen cases, Mulder, of fakers and lucky guessers but no one that has ever been able to stand up to any kind of rigorous testing. No one who has gone so far as to claim that they can zero in on the mind of one person in a crowd of thousands.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe that’s why they want him dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who? Who are you talking about?

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m not the mind reader.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Say that what you’re suggesting were even possible, who’d want to kill a kid whose abilities would offer you the ultimate advantage … I mean in business, in war, in anything?

speaker: DIANA
line: Maybe somebody whose business is in keeping secrets.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, let’s test him. I think the kid will stand up. Let’s run a brain scan and a psych evaluation on him. You know what to do, Diana.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, you two know each other?

speaker: DIANA
line: It was a long time ago.

speaker: SPENDER
line: What are you doing here?

speaker: MULDER
line: I want to talk to the shooter.

speaker: SPENDER
line: I’ve just spent the last six hours talking with him. He’s not been what I would call forthcoming.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay. Let me see what I can do.

speaker: SPENDER
line: I prefer you stay out of there. In fact, I prefer you stay out of this thing altogether.

speaker: MULDER
line: When I first met you I figured you were just ambitious. This morning, my opinion changed. I thought you were arrogant. Now I’m beginning to wonder what you’re protecting.

speaker: SPENDER
line: I’m just trying to run this right, not like some ridiculous paranormal free-for-all.

speaker: MULDER
line: You’re insulting me when you should be taking notes. Somehow, you got the big assignment but just because you’re wearing the suit doesn’t mean it fits. You’re lucky you’re not defusing some international incident kissing serious Russian ass and sending a lot of agents barking down a lot of bad leads. Now, the kid is the key to this and the shooter knows why. Excuse me.

speaker: MULDER
line: What does it take to kill a kid? Money? Or just evil stupidity?

speaker: GUNMAN
line: I didn’t kill a kid.

speaker: MULDER
line: No … Thanks to the kid.

speaker: GUNMAN
line: Want to talk about heartlessness? Your squeaky friend there … hasn’t given me any food or water for what – 16 hours?

speaker: MULDER
line: I won’t tolerate that. Spender, you got to get this guy some food. Come on.

speaker: GUNMAN
line: I’ve got nothing to say.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah … I read your bio. You’ve been trained. Special Forces. You were in Grenada, Zaire. You were inside Saddam’s palace with a hit squad when they started raining bombs down over it yet you failed to kill him as well.

speaker: GUNMAN
line: Like I said …

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, I know – you got nothing to say. That’s okay. I’m a pretty good guesser. The kid reads minds. How’s that? Why don’t I tell him you told me that, and then let’s see how safe and snug you feel in here.

speaker: GUNMAN
line: What can you do for me?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t know. I might be able to get you immunity or, uh … get you into the witness protection program.

speaker: GUNMAN
line: Never happen.

speaker: MULDER
line: Think about it.

speaker: SPENDER
line: What did you get? Did you get anything?

speaker: MULDER
line: Just his attention.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How you doing?

speaker: GIBSON
line: I didn’t like those tests. I didn’t like being in the machine.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hmm … They’re a little scary, aren’t they?

speaker: GIBSON
line: You’re wondering, aren’t you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: About what? About you?

speaker: GIBSON
line: About that other girl.

speaker: GIBSON
line: She’s wondering about you, too.

speaker: DOCTOR 1
line: We’re going to show you a group of cards and as we look at them we want you to tell us what we’re thinking. Now, take as much time as you need.

speaker: GIBSON
line: Chair. Piano. Piece of pie. Light bulb. Smiley face. Statue. Cat.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’s amazing. It’s hard to believe.

speaker: DIANA
line: I’ve witnessed clairvoyants who were over 90% accurate and seen telepathy being demonstrated but I don’t know I’ve ever witnessed anything quite like this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where’d you see that?

speaker: DIANA
line: Agent Mulder and I spent some time in psychiatric hospitals. There were some patients serving criminal sentences who we felt had been misdiagnosed.

speaker: GIBSON
line: … omelette. Coffee and a cruller. A nonfat latte. An english muffin. Grand Slam number two with double hash browns and a side of Canadian bacon.

speaker: DOCTOR 1
line: He just told us all what we ate for breakfast.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have to disappear for a bit.

speaker: GUARD
line: I was handed a note. Now I’m handing it to you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is somebody going to let me in?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Yeah. Yeah. Coming. Coming.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Sorry. You caught me getting ready for bed. Come in. Come in.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: To what do we owe the pleasure at this late night hour?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I need your help.

speaker: LANGLY
line: With what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You’ve all heard of Gibson Praise the chess wunderkind. These are a series of scans and neural electrical outputs of his brain and brain processes. There seems to be some suspicion that he’s a fraud.

speaker: BYERS
line: Dorf on chess?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, apparently, he wins by reading his opponents’ minds.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: I love that.

speaker: LANGLY
line: And you want us to what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Analyze the data … with an eye to the parapsychological.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Ooh …. A walk on the wild side.

speaker: SCULLY
line: First … I want you guys to tell me who Diana Fowley is.

speaker: BYERS
line: Diana Fowley? Geez, we haven’t heard that name in a while.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then you know her.

speaker: BYERS
line: Well … yeeaaah.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: She was Mulder’s chickadee when he just got out of the Academy. Good-looking.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, she claims to have worked closely with him for a while.

speaker: LANGLY
line: She was there when he discovered the X-Files. She has a background of para-science.

speaker: BYERS
line: She got a legat appointment a while back … in Berlin. I always wondered why they split up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well … Why don’t you boys see what you can find?

speaker: SILVER SURFER
line: I must make my stand.

speaker: GALACTUS
line: Your stand will destroy you.

speaker: SILVER SURFER
line: Better to perish for what I believe in than endure forever as a traitor to life.

speaker: GALACTUS
line: Then, so be it.

speaker: MULDER
line: How’s little Karnac doing?

speaker: DIANA
line: Put a TV in front of him and he turns right into a normal kid. He’s the real deal, Fox. We tested him with Zener cards, random numbers, a variety of ESP tasking. He’s got ability to not just focus on a thought, but a multitude of thoughts at once.

speaker: MULDER
line: There’s something else. There’s something we’re missing here.

speaker: DIANA
line: That was a good catch on the videotape. I was impressed.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, you would have caught it eventually.

speaker: DIANA
line: No. I’ve been too many years trying to get inside the head of too many Arab terrorists. I’m out of practice with this stuff. But you seem at the top of your game.

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s all I do. That’s all I’ve been doing for the last five years. Been my life, such as it is.

speaker: DIANA
line: Sometimes I hear about you... about the work you’re doing. And I think how it might have been if I’d stayed.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ah, we’d all be blown up by some terrorist bomb, no doubt, huh?

speaker: DIANA
line: I sense you could have used an ally, though – someone who thinks like you, with some background.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, you mean Scully?

speaker: DIANA
line: She’s not what I would call an open mind on the subject.

speaker: MULDER
line: She’s a, uh... she’s a scientist. She just makes me work for everything.

speaker: DIANA
line: Yes, but I’m... I’m sure there were times when two like minds on a case would have been advantageous.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’ve done okay without you.

speaker: DIANA
line: Hey... I’m on your side.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it’s me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where are you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m, uh, I’m on my way to work. I was hoping I could show you something. Something about the boy.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I’m at the psych facility with him right now. Why don’t you come by and show me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, no, I’d... I’d prefer to show you at work if that’s okay.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, what is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think you’ll be surprised. Very surprised.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m on my way.

speaker: CSM
line: Agent Spender. I need to speak with you.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Who are you?

speaker: CSM
line: Somebody who’s taken an interest in you... in this case of yours. This case I gave you.

speaker: SPENDER
line: What are you? CIA? NSA?

speaker: CSM
line: You’re a bright boy.

speaker: SPENDER
line: You said you had information.

speaker: CSM
line: Control the board. Know which men to sacrifice and when.

speaker: SPENDER
line: I don’t know what you’re talking about.

speaker: CSM
line: Don’t become part of someone else’s cause or crusade. Pursue your own self interest. Always.

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Spender! Agent Spender? Who were you talking to?

speaker: SPENDER
line: I don’t know.

speaker: MULDER
line: You don’t know who you were talking to? You’re lying.

speaker: SPENDER
line: What’s your deal?

speaker: MULDER
line: I was told he was dead.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Well, obviously whoever it is, he’s not.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You’re here to tell me a story.

speaker: MULDER
line: Tell him exactly as you told me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’ve conducted some tests on Gibson Praise and have come up with some rather with what I know.

speaker: SKINNER
line: These are?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Neurological tests. Mapping of brain functions using a very high resolution EEG.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What did you find out?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The tests revealed something peculiar in an area of the brain that we are only beginning to understand. An area of the temporal lobe that neurophysicists are calling the "God nodule."

speaker: SKINNER
line: I hope I’m not going to hear that this kid is the next Christ child.

speaker: SCULLY
line: All of the boy’s brain processes are showing extraordinary activity in exactly this part of the brain. Which is not just abnormal or anomalous, but from what I know absolutely unheard of.

speaker: MULDER
line: There are corollaries – The individuals who have been responsible for great leaps forward in understanding in science. Newton, Galileo, Einstein, Stephen Hawking. All these men exhibited modes of thinking that are suggestive of access to special brain centers.

speaker: SKINNER
line: All right. So this kid is a human oddity. Tell me why anyone would go to such lengths as to kill him?

speaker: MULDER
line: This kid may be the key not just to all human potential, but to all spiritual unexplained paranormal phenomena. The key to everything in the X-Files.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Let me get this right --- We’re supposed to believe that this boy was going to be killed because of the X-Files?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, it’s bigger than that.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Uh-huh. Explain it to me. To us.

speaker: MULDER
line: I can’t. But the shooter can. The assassin that you have locked up... in exchange for immunity from prosecution.

speaker: SPENDER
line: You want to give a murderer a free ride for the secrets to the pyramids? This is crazy. It’s nuts.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You mischaracterize what I’ve said. This would be quantifiable scientific proof of everything Agent Mulder and I have investigated over the past five years.

speaker: DIANA
line: How do you quantify the spiritual? It can’t be done. You ask for immunity for a killer on that basis, the Attorney General’s gonna go off. You’re allowed to investigate the X-Files as an indulgence. But draw the wrong kind of attention and they’ll close you down. Put an end to all your work. Something I happen to have an interest in myself.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Let’s everyone step out into the hall.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Mulder, you stay put.

speaker: SKINNER
line: She’s right, you know. The risk you’re taking, the long-term plans that you and I talked about…

speaker: MULDER
line: If what Agent Scully’s found is true and I have every reason to believe that it is, then the answers I might have spent a lifetime searching for may fall together like a million puzzle pieces.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You’d risk the X-Files?

speaker: MULDER
line: How soon can you call the Attorney General?

speaker: MULDER
line: The Attorney General’s heard my request for immunity.

speaker: GUNMAN
line: Heard it? You … Oh … You said that you could get it.

speaker: MULDER
line: She needs something more. Something to convince her that you’re not just playing games. Something that I can corroborate. I need answers from you.

speaker: GUNMAN
line: The kid is a missing link.

speaker: MULDER
line: To what?

speaker: MULDER
line: He’s genetic proof, isn’t he?

speaker: SPENDER
line: Genetic proof of what? Genetic proof of what?

speaker: MULDER
line: The kid’s not superhuman. He’s just more human than human.

speaker: SPENDER
line: He’s what?

speaker: MULDER
line: Most of us have genes we don’t use. They lie there dormant, turned off. Science doesn’t know what they’re for, why they’re there or where they came from.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Right and you think this has something to do with that?

speaker: MULDER
line: There’s a long-held but unpopular theory tied to prehistoric evidence of alien astronauts.

speaker: SPENDER
line: You’re not going to go out there and say the kid’s part alien.

speaker: SPENDER
line: You think that’s what you heard? You led him, Agent Mulder. Now you’re letting yourself be led.

speaker: WMM
line: We entrusted you. You failed.

speaker: CSM
line: Failed. Failed who?

speaker: WMM
line: Mulder has gone to the Justice Department. He has testimony about the boy.

speaker: CSM
line: That’s just part of the game.

speaker: WMM
line: It’s not a game, for God’s sake.

speaker: CSM
line: Sure it is. It’s all a game. You just take their pieces, one by one until the board is clear.

speaker: WMM
line: God ….

speaker: COTTON
line: Hey, Missy! How about some sammiches? Hmm.

speaker: PEG
line: I hope you're all hungry.

speaker: HANK
line: Good-looking breakfast, Peg.

speaker: COTTON
line: Yeah. I see bacon, I see ham...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Gibson?

speaker: GIBSON
line: This is a great show. I wish we got this where I live. march yourself down to the Safeway …

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’d like to ask you something. but I am just a little too busy living here in the latter half of the 20th century.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How do you do it?

speaker: GIBSON
line: I just hear you thinking … like on a radio. And sometimes there are lots of radios. And I want to shut them off and watch some TV.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is that why you like chess? ‘Cause it’s just one thought that you hear?

speaker: GIBSON
line: Yeah, but that’s not why I like it all the time.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why else do you like it?

speaker: GIBSON
line: Because there’s no talking. Just thinking. It’s nothing like real life where people think one thing but they say something else.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is that what people do?

speaker: GIBSON
line: They’re so worried about what other people are thinking when the people they’re worrying about are worried about the same thing. It makes me laugh.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why?

speaker: GIBSON
line: They make up all this stuff to believe but it’s all made up. Some people try to be good people but some people just don’t care. Like you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You think I don’t care?

speaker: GIBSON
line: No, you don’t care what people think. Except for her. The other one.

speaker: DIANA
line: I’m here to relieve you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, we’ll talk about this later, okay?

speaker: GIBSON
line: They want to kill me, you know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Nobody’s going to do anything to you, Gibson. I promise.

speaker: GIBSON
line: I know you do.

speaker: HANK
line: Well, that's the dangedest thing. I never heard of a solenoid just disappearing before.

speaker: DALE
line: I don't know. Sometimes things just disappear for no logical reason. One day my cousin woke up, his kidney was gone.]

speaker: GUARD
line: I’ve been handed another note.

speaker: DIANA
line: Gibson?

speaker: DIANA
line: What are you doing?

speaker: GIBSON
line: There’s a man with a gun.

speaker: DIANA
line: Gibson, get down. Get back. Get back.

speaker: GIBSON
line: He didn’t come here to kill me. He’s aiming at you.

speaker: DIANA
line: Wha …

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Mulder, Scully. They killed a US Marshal and then shot Agent Fowley.

speaker: SKINNER
line: They worked on her here for an hour. They couldn’t get a chopper in so they’re in radio communication with the hospital. She’s got weak vitals and a hole in one of her lungs, so they’re not optimistic.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What about the boy? Is he here?

speaker: MULDER
line: Where’s Spender?

speaker: SKINNER
line: He’s gone to Federal Detention. They found the shooter shot dead in his cell early this morning. We also found this.

speaker: WMM
line: Hello, young man.

speaker: GIBSON
line: Hello.

speaker: WMM
line: There’s nothing to be afraid of.

speaker: GIBSON
line: You’re a liar. Just like him.

speaker: CSM
line: You’ve never had the stomach for our business.

speaker: WMM
line: Just not for your practices.

speaker: CSM
line: I’m a necessity. The complement to your cowardice.

speaker: WMM
line: Your work is done now.

speaker: CSM
line: My work is just beginning.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I got a nice, straight shot.

speaker: WMM
line: No. He’s useful. And you may need him in the future.

speaker: SPENDER
line: … secure the airports. Notify the parents and the Philippine government the boy’s missing, and …

speaker: MULDER
line: Who do you work for?! You work for him -- You and Old Smokey --- Is that who put this together?! You’re going down for this! I’m going to see you prosecuted for murder! You watch me! Watch it happen! Your days are numbered!

speaker: SPENDER
line: You’re wrong, Agent Mulder. It’s your days that are numbered.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We knew there were risks going to the Attorney General.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You know what's coming down here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: They’re serious about this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I understand.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I assume you’ll make Agent Mulder aware of this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, I’m - I’m here with him now.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm making a case his personal involvement clouded his judgment but I don't know the Attorney General's listening.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’ll communicate that to him. Is there anything else – any other news?

speaker: SKINNER
line: You should know Agent Spender's going after Mulder full bore. He's been reciting some line about "Alien Astronauts." It makes you both look real bad.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Right. Well, I’ll be here if you need to reach me.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I've got to get back in there.

speaker: MULDER
line: Any news on Diana?

speaker: SCULLY
line: They have her on maximum pressers but she’s barely maintaining her pressure.

speaker: MULDER
line: What did Skinner have to say?

speaker: SCULLY
line: There are talks going on right now about reassignment.

speaker: MULDER
line: For who?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Both of us. These talks included instructions from the Justice Department to close down the X-Files.

speaker: MULDER
line: This was all strategized – every move. I just couldn’t see it. It was all of a plan.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, whatever you may believe, this time they may have won.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Can I help you?

speaker: CSM
line: Actually, uh .. I can help you.

speaker: SPENDER
line: How did you get in here?

speaker: CSM
line: Access, Agent Spender. It’s about access. It’s what I can give you. It’s what can make you. It’s why I’m doing this for you.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Who are you?

speaker: CSM
line: I’m your father.

speaker: SPENDER
line: What?!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Mulder …
